p:
Each test was repeated three times. The percent inhibition was calculated as follows:
\documentclass[12pt]{minimal} \usepackage{amsmath} \usepackage{wasysym} \usepackage{amsfonts} \usepackage{amssymb} \usepackage{amsbsy} \usepackage{mathrsfs} \usepackage{upgreek} \setlength{\oddsidemargin}{-69pt} \begin{document}$${\rm{Percent}}\,\mathrm{inhibition}\,( \% )=\frac{{\rm{Gc}}-{\rm{Gt}}}{{\rm{Gc}}}\times 100,$$\end{document}
Percent
inhibition
( % ) =
Gc − Gt
Gc
× 100 ,
where Gc and Gt represent the germination rate in control and treated Petri dishes, respectively.
